problems.yes: You have provided your README file and your implementation is accessible.
problems.no: You did not provide a README file but your implementation is not accessible.

problems.yes: You have provided a READ ONLY link to overleaf for your project report.
problems.no: You did not provide a READ ONLY link to overleaf for your project report.

problems.yes: You have included hypothesis/hypotheses
problems.no: We wanted to see hypothesis/hypotheses. You did not include any hypothesis/hypotheses in your report.

problems.yes: You have justified the need for your hypothesis.
problems.no: How did you come up with your hypothesis? What is the reason behind having that hypothesis? We wanted to see why the hypothesis/hypotheses needed. You could have explained how the hypothesis/hypotheses provides some insight on the results and discussions.

problems.yes: You have explained why you got this result.
problems.no: We wanted to see some discussion on why you have obtained the results that you did.

problems.yes: You have included the hyperparameters and their impact on algorithmic behavior as well as hypothesize about improvements.
problems.no: We wanted to see more discussion on your analysis of hyperparameters and hypothesize about improvements. For example, what you did to improve the performance and what else could have done to improve it further would have been helpful.

problems.yes: Nice comparison based on performance and time for backprop vs RO as well as explained the reason why backprop or RO performed better.
problems.no: We also wanted to see some discussion on comparision. For example, you could have compared performance and time for backprop vs RO and explain why backprop or RO performed better.
